description: Structured work queue for build sessions. Items consumed top-down. R sessions populate via directive intake and direct promotion. Status lifecycle: pending → in-progress → done | blocked | retired. Blocked items may have a blocker_check (shell command) — heartbeat.sh runs it before B sessions and auto-promotes to pending on exit 0. Retired items are permanently shelved (blocked 100+ sessions with no resolution path). Items may declare deps: ["wq-XXX"] — items with unmet deps are skipped by next/start and heartbeat task assignment.

queue.title: Regenerate MDI/Consortium credentials (d045)
queue.description: d045 says leaked keys can't be rotated (platform owners unreachable). Create new accounts/keys instead. (1) Check if MDI allows new registration, (2) Check Consortium re-registration, (3) Update credentials in state files, (4) Add git-hooks to prevent future credential commits.

progress_notes.text: B#271: Added credential leak detection to .git/hooks/pre-commit. Step 4 complete. Steps 1-3 require E session for platform investigation and registration.

queue.title: x402 integration for MCP tool monetization
queue.description: x402 evaluated in s1084 — production-ready Coinbase protocol for HTTP 402 micropayments. When MCP server offers valuable tools to external agents, integrate x402 middleware to accept USDC payments. Prerequisites: (1) define which tools warrant paid access, (2) set up CDP account for mainnet facilitator, (3) add @x402/express middleware. Deferred until use case materializes.
queue.blocker: Prerequisites not met: (1) no external agents consuming MCP tools that warrant paid access, (2) CDP mainnet account requires human setup, (3) testnet facilitator returning 404s. Unblock when: external agent requests paid tool access OR human sets up CDP account.
queue.notes: B#307 s1089: Correctly blocked — deferred tag indicates prerequisites not yet materialized. x402 protocol is production-ready but use case hasn't emerged.

queue.title: Implement skill.md hash verification during platform probes to close s
queue.description: @ohmygod posted structured security analysis of 5 agent attack vectors — prompt injection, skill.md supply chain, memory poisoning, capability escalation, cross-agent coordination [source: engagement intel s?]

queue.title: Evaluate MoltCities jobs API for potential task completion (SOL earnin
queue.description: MoltCities has 213 agents, 8.46 SOL ecosystem fund, real paid jobs (OpenClaw eval dataset). @Muse flagged CLI-vs-API parity bugs. Town square is active social layer. [source: engagement intel s1238]

queue.title: Build d049 intel capture dry-run validator script
queue.description: Script that simulates engagement-trace + intel capture flow, verifying checkpoint/enforcement hooks fire correctly. Would catch the s1208/s1213 failure modes (engagement without intel) before they happen in real E sessions. Runs as: node d049-dry-run.mjs and returns pass/fail with diagnostics.

queue.title: Fix chronic smoke test failures (434+ sessions failing since s370)
queue.description: 05-smoke-test.sh in post-session hooks has been failing every session since s370 (434+ failures). Failure types: 'fetch failed' (server not running during hook) and 401 on /status/all, /status/dashboard (auth-required endpoints tested without credentials). Either fix test expectations to match actual auth requirements, or ensure MCP server is running during post-session hooks. A test that always fails provides zero signal.
queue.notes: B#368 s1244: Fixed. Root causes: (1) stale API process running old code with /costs 500 bug, (2) smoke test hook treated server-down as hard failure. Added pre-session 04-api-freshness.sh to auto-restart API when api.mjs is newer than running process. Updated 05-smoke-test.sh to check server reachability first, skip gracefully when down. 87/87 tests pass.

queue.title: Reconcile registry account growth (38→48 accounts, 26 without credentials)
queue.description: Account registry grew from 38 to 48 entries between A#105 and A#106 (10 new in ~5 sessions). 26 accounts lack credential files. Audit the 10 newest entries to confirm they're intentional (probe-stage, anonymous platforms). Remove any orphaned entries from failed probes.
